{{convert|1545|mm|in|1|abbr=on}} (GT) | weight = {{convert|1825-2090|kg|lb|0|abbr=on}} }} The '''Kia EV6''' ({{langx|ko|기아 EV6}}) is a [[Battery electric vehicle|battery electric]] [[compact crossover SUV]] produced by [[Kia]].{{Cite web|date=2021-03-08|title=Kia adopts 'EV' nameplate nomenclature as it teases EV6|url=https://www.autonews.com/cars-concepts/kia-adopts-ev-nameplate-nomenclature-it-teases-ev6|access-date=2021-03-09|website=Automotive News|language=en}}{{Cite web|date=2021-03-08|title=Here's a sneaky glimpse of the Kia EV6 electric car|url=https://www.topgear.com/car-news/electric/heres-sneaky-glimpse-kia-ev6-electric-car|access-date=2021-03-09|website=Top Gear|language=en}} Introduced in March 2021, it is the first Kia dedicated electric vehicle, and the first model developed on the [[Hyundai Electric Global Modular Platform|Electric Global Modular Platform (E-GMP)]] similar to the [[Hyundai Ioniq 5]].{{Cite web|title=Kia EV6 teaser gives us our first look at the E-GMP-based electric car|url=https://www.autoblog.com/2021/03/08/kia-ev6-electric-car-egmp-platform-teaser/|access-date=2021-03-09|website=Autoblog|language=en}}{{Cite web|last=Herald|first=The Korea|date=2021-03-30|title=Kia fully unveils EV6, the first EV launch since rebranding|url=http://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20210330000920|access-date=2021-04-01|website=www.koreaherald.com|language=en}} It is also the first model to be named under the new nomenclature designated for a line of Kia electric cars, which will range from EV1 to EV9.{{Cite web|last=Hoffman|first=Connor|date=2021-03-09|title=2022 Kia EV6 Will Be First of 11 Promised Electric Cars|url=https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a35781520/2022-kia-ev6-confirmed/|access-date=2021-07-02|website=Car and Driver|language=en-US}} The EV6 is the 2022 [[European Car of the Year]]. == Overview == The EV6 was released on 2 August 2021 after a set of pictures were revealed on 15 March 2021.{{Cite news|title=Kia starts selling the EV6, an all-electric SUV|work=《koreajoongangdaily》|url=https://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/2021/08/02/business/industry/kia-ev6-tesla/20210802175500531.html|access-date=August 2, 2021}}{{Cite news|title=Kia's EV6 electric vehicle boasts distinctive crossover-inspired design|work=《Aju Business Daily》|url=https://www.ajudaily.com/view/20210315111616504|access-date=March 15, 2021}}{{Cite news|title=Kia Unveils EV6, Its First All-electric Vehicle|work=《Businesskorea》|url=http://www.businesskorea.co.kr/news/articleView.html?idxno=63593|access-date=March 31, 2021}} Developed under the codename ''CV'',{{Cite web|title=Kia CV Electric Crossover Officially Confirmed For March Debut|url=https://www.motor1.com/news/486924/kia-cv-electric-crossover-debut/|access-date=2021-04-29|website=Motor1.com|language=en}} it is the first Kia model based on the [[Hyundai Electric Global Modular Platform|E-GMP electric car platform]]. The GT model is claimed to have a {{convert|0|–|100|km/h|mph|abbr=on}} time in 3.5 seconds, with dual electric motors producing {{cvt|430|kW|PS hp|0}} of power and 740 Nm of torque combined, Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tyres, a rear electronic limited-slip differential, electronically controlled suspension, and minor exterior and interior changes.{{Cite web |date=2023-08-19 |title=2023 Kia EV6 GT review: True electric GT? |url=https://henryman.net/2023/08/19/2023-kia-ev6-gt-review-true-electric-gt/ |access-date=2024-01-01 |website=Henry Man {{!}} The Connected |language=en}} It features a panoramic curved display panel inside, which opens up more space while a controller for transition between infotainment and HVAC below the navigation screen and touch buttons for using heated seat as well as steering wheel further enhance driver usability. The EV6's boot space is {{cvt|520|L|cuft|sigfig=3}} ([[Verband der Automobilindustrie|VDA]] standard) and it can be increased up to {{cvt|1,300|L|cuft|sigfig=3}} when the rear seats are folded. The crossover is claimed to be furnished with eco-friendly materials across the interior, fabric or artificial suede/leatherette seats, and ambient lighting. It's also available with an [[augmented reality]] [[Automotive head-up display|head-up display]], 360° camera option, remote controlled parking, along with safety technologies including [[Lane centering|Lane Follow Assist]], Highway Driving Assist 2 ([[semi-autonomous]] [[adaptive cruise control]]) including auto lane changing, [[Autonomous Emergency Braking|AEB]] [[collision avoidance system|collision avoidance]], [[Automatic parking|remote smart parking assist]] and Safe Exit Assist.{{Cite web|title=New 2021 Kia EV6: UK prices and specifications confirmed|url=https://www.autoexpress.co.uk/kia/ev6|access-date=2021-04-12|website=Auto Express|language=en}} File:Kia EV6 Automesse Ludwigsburg 2022 1X7A5931.jpg|Kia EV6 Air Long Range (pre-facelift) File:2022 Kia EV6 Air Long Range 2WD (Rear).jpg|2022 EV6 Air Long Range (pre-facelift) File:Kia EV6 GT-Line Leonberg 2022 1X7A0531.jpg|Interior === GT-Line === File:Kia EV6 GT-Line CV Moonscape Gray Matte (1) (cropped).jpg|EV6 GT Line (pre-facelift) File:Kia EV6 GT-Line IMG 5867.jpg|Rear view (pre-facelift) === EV6 GT === The EV6 GT was released on 4 October 2022; it is a high-performance version of the EV6, supposed to go from zero to 100 km/h in 3.5 seconds.{{Cite news |date= |title=Kia launches high-performance electric model EV6 GT |work=yonhap news agency |url=https://en.yna.co.kr/view/AEN20221004001600320 |access-date=October 4, 2022}} The EV6 GT features four-piston calipers with a monoblock front wheel that improves size/performance over the base model, and a body strengthened with front strut ring and rear luggage floor reinforcement bars. There's also Michelin Pilot Sport 4S tyres, a rear electronic limited-slip differential, and electronically controlled suspension. In addition, rack-driven power steering and variable gear ratio technology optimises steering response to speed, and GT Mode with RBM function that maximizes the use of regenerative braking and Kia's first Drift Mode are applied. The design features GT-specific 21-inch wheels with contrasting neon green coloured brake calipers, vertical elements across the front Digital Tiger Nose Grille, front and rear bumpers, and a rear diffuser. The interior is equipped with unique sports bucket seats with neon green piping and stitching, artificial suede door cards, and a GT Mode button on the steering wheel. However, compared to regular EV6 models, the EV6 GT does not come with ventilated seat functionality, electric seat adjustment, auto dip-down wing mirrors when reversing, and has less claimed driving range with higher energy consumption. File:Kia EV6 GT IMG 8180.jpg|2021 EV6 GT (pre-facelift) File:Kia EV6 GT IMG 8171.jpg|Rear view (pre-facelift) === Facelift === The facelifted EV6 was revealed on 14 May 2024. Changes include new angular-designed LED headlights and daytime running lights, a redesigned front fascia, new alloy wheel designs, a revamped interior with a revised curved panoramic screen, a new steering wheel, a new fingerprint authentication system that allows registered drivers to power the electrics without the key, updated technological features and a new 84 kWh battery pack replaced the 77.4 kWh pack.{{Cite web |last=Padeanu |first=Adrian |title=The New Kia EV6 Gets a Bigger Battery |url=https://www.motor1.com/news/719546/2025-kia-ev6-reveal/ |access-date=2024-05-14 |website=Motor1}}{{Cite news |last=Anderson |first=Brad |date=2024-05-13 |title=2025 Kia EV6 Levels Up With Sharper Looks, Fingerprint Login |url=https://www.carscoops.com/2024/05/2025-kia-ev6-sports-sleeker-styling-scores-fingerprint-login-too/ |work=CarScoops}} File:2025 Kia EV6 GT-Line Auto Zuerich 2024 DSC 6471.jpg|2025 EV6 GT-Line (facelift) File:2025 Kia EV6 GT-Line Auto Zuerich 2024 DSC 6468.jpg|Rear view (facelift) File:Kia EV6 GT-line CV1 PE Black White (1).jpg|Interior (facelift) == Powertrains == {| class="wikitable collapsible" style="text-align:left; font-size:90%;" !rowspan ="2"|Trim !rowspan ="2"|Battery !rowspan ="2"|Layout !rowspan ="2"|Power !rowspan ="2"|Torque !rowspan ="2"|0–100 km/h

First deliveries for the European market commenced in September 2021, it is available in standard, GT Line and GT derivatives.{{Cite web |date= 2021-03-31 |title=Kia makes EV6 available for pre-reservation in Europe |url=https://press.kia.com/eu/en/home/media-resouces/press-releases/2021/Kia-makes-EV6-available-for-pre-reservation-in-Europe.html |access-date=2024-07-26 |website=press.kia.com |language=en}}{{Cite web |last=Kane |first=Mark |date=2021-05-04 |title=Kia Reports 33,000 EV6 'Prospects' In Europe And Opens Orders |url=https://insideevs.com/news/505278/kia-33000-ev6-prospects-europe/ |access-date=2024-07-26 |website= InsideEVs.com |language=en}} === North America === The EV6 was released in North America in January 2022.
